title: Fans from NA who shit on NA
body:
you guys are a cancer to North American e-sports.

Seriously some of the posts I've been seeing seconds after the games ended, you'd think you're all from EU, and just transferred your accounts. Is it really so difficult for you to acknowledge that CLG defied the odds and gave a performance to be proud of? Or do you not want our region to grow at all? 

I know I'm gonna get flamed and downvoted for this, but I had to get it off my chest. NA "fans" are one of NA's biggest obstacles to growing as a competitive scene.

EDIT: After reading some of the more reasonable responses to my words, I have a few things I'd like to add to this post so as to not generalize. 

1. I think it's perfectly OK to have your favorite team be in a different region. I'm personally always rooting for a different team in every region. CLG for NA, OG for EUW, SKT for KR, etc. I think the problem arises when people in our region actively bash our competitive scene, as it harms the local reputation of the NA LCS and discourages investment in it from possible sponsors and fans. 

2. Many people seem to forget that despite their rocky start in the group stages, SKT are the best team in the world, possibly the best team of all time, and CLG gave them a fight. Yes, running the same comp twice was dumb and running Poppy into Trundle twice even made me facepalm, but even though they got 3-0'd, it wasn't a steamroll like the last game of worlds last year, or even some of the RNG vs. SKT games. 

That's all for now.

This season saw us come further than we ever had, going toe to toe with the best teams in the world and making it to the finals of a major international event against the greatest League of Legends team of all-time, and refusing to go down without a fight, and that still isn't good enough for our inner tumors to acknowledge that we've grown, and that this performance could inspire a major growth in our competitive scene as well. Just because I'm from NA doesn't mean I have to support NA at all. I've loved SKT for about 3 years now. Although I'm not saying NA is trash, since CLG made it far, I will happily say they are not on the level of Korea and rather nowhere near. 

Now, if you're referring to NA fans shitting on NA, yeah that sucks dick. I personally interpreted it as "Fans from NA" as in fans of other teams but are in NA, hence voting for the "Wrong" team, but the former is probably correct. Fans should never shit on their own team. Displeased, sure. Don't need to be obligated to be proud of CLG and all humble, but at least not call them trash.

I of course don't believe you're under any obligation to support NA, and hell man, I love SKT too, how can you not? It just bothers me that we've really grown as a region so far this season, and CLG's performance could inspire growth in the scene as a whole, forcing TSM, C9, and IMT (who, admittedly, probably would've been in CLG's place here if they hadn't trolled the semifinals), to grow now that we've shown what an NA team is capable of, and these salt piles still have to try to diminish their accomplishment.
How the hell was that final performance something to be proud of? Them getting there was amazing. the finals was horrible. Losing is one thing but losing like that? Holy shit that was bad.

But saying they're shit is like saying ROX is shit for losing in the LCK final. They beat literally everyone except Korea (and technically China), you can say they sucked during the final, but saying they're the worst in the world again because they lost to the best team in the world is stupid.

None said that CLG is the worst... Do you remember season5 worlds when ThrowSeriousMatches was the world's punching bag? CLG is  a good team. But what they did today in game 2 was at least humiliating. They humiliated themselves with that cocky attitude. Let's not forget that for Managers and sponsors, this is still just Bussines. So, i wouldn't be surprised if i see big roster changes next season or even next split...

Losing is one thing, but losing in that manner is something else...
#NotLikeThis

It might be cool that a team from NA got to the finals, but not everyone in NA enjoys CLG. 

If you look at the team, and organization as a whole, there is a lot of reasons why people from NA would not support CLG. Yes, they might be good players, but that's like saying everyone should support Tom Brady because he is a good player. If you look at the team's history and actually care about FAIR and competitive e-sports, CLG is not a good team to hold up to represent NA as a region. They have been penalized not once, but THREE times for breaking LCS rules when they attempted to poach Zionspartan (Darshan) and Scarra from other LCS teams, AND account sharing while in Korea (admittedly it was partly Riot's fault, but at the same time account sharing is NEVER allowed). So, why should a NA fan be happy with a team that has a history of competitive issues with breaking the rules? I don't support CLG because of their history of blatantly violating the rules for LCS. NO other LCS team has had this many issues with breaking the rules. 

So yeah, CLG did well in an international competition. Yes, they are from NA, but that doesn't mean people think CLG as an organization or a team supports or represents the values of the NA region. I don't know about you, but I do not endorse teams that have a history of breaking the rules to represent the NA region and represent the NA values.

Haters are going to hate. I love when people talk about bad pros are (in any sport) when those pros could beat their salty fans with one arm tied behind their back and blindfolded. Its like "If the pros are trash then what are you?"

Lol but we're not pros are we? When people say pros are bad, it's usually in comparison to other pros. Everyone below masters (and maybe high diamond) is bad at the game, we all know that and no one pretends to be better than the pros, but comparing the pros between each other? That's fair game: can you objectively say that huhi isn't bad compared to faker?

What I'm saying is you shouldn't disrespect someone who is far better at something than you.  It makes you look incredibly pathetic, like one of those obese NFL fans who complain that their wide receivers aren't fast enough.  Its like "dude, when was the last time you were able to touch your toes let alone run a 100 yard dash."

You get the same idiots who call UFC fighters pussies.  If you wouldn't say it to the person's face then you shouldn't say it period.  If you met Huhi would you say "wow, you're trash compared to Faker."  I sure hope not because you'd look like a complete fool if you did and he probably wouldn't stop laughing at you.

All I'm asking is people stop being two-faced.

That's basically the "why don't you do better" argument, which is basically never valid. If someone looks poor when compared to their peers and someone who is worse criticizes them, their points aren't made any less true because of it.

Or, in other words, just because I'm bad when compared to the players from, say, C9, doesn't make them not bad when they're compared to SKT.

Not at all.

Its fine to criticize people but you shouldn't be disrespectful about it.  Basically, you shouldn't say something that you wouldn't say to the person's face.  That's just two-faced and cowardly.

Let me get this straight: if I have the courage to go to huhi's face and tell him that he's bad compared to faker, does that make it ok for me to say it on the boards? Honestly, I would say it to his face, and if he laughed, I'd be laughing right back at him since I said nothing that wasn't true. There is nothing disrespectful about saying that a pro is bad compared to another pro (comparing him to yourself however is a different matter) and let's be real, they chose this job, they should be prepared to be criticized. Just look over at EU and G2: they went into MSI with no practice and finished 5th, they've just lost a lot of respect from  the eu fans and are rightfully being criticized.

I don't think most people would say the stuff they say on the boards in real life.  People have a whole lot of "internet courage" and its really pathetic.

If you're one of the few who would then I definitely have more respect for you that most.  That said, I still don't think you should be disrespectful to anyone, let alone a pro who is far superior to you.  Its fine to be critical but disrespect is never justified.

People confuse being disrespectful to giving an opinion. What's disrespectful about saying a pro is better than an other if it's backed up by facts? I don't think saying faker is better than huhi is being disrespectful, do you? It's just an honest opinion (that some could consider fact) and is not disrespectful towards huhi. It's just criticism of his play, and it's exactly that criticism that pushes people to push themselves to be better. If you're not motivated by criticism, then I don't know what can motivate you more than proving people wrong and going and winning a trophy.

Yeah, that's perfectly reasonable.  If you say something like "he frequently mispositions in team fights and doesn't roam as often as he should" then that is a valid criticism that is actually constructive.  However, most people don't say that.  Most people say "he's garbage", "he's trash", "I'm better than him", "he doesn't deserve to be on a LCS team", etc, etc, etc.  That's not criticism, that's disrespect.

Its very similar to people raging in game.  Calling your teammates trash and telling them to stop feeding is not criticism, its disrespect.  You aren't helping them, you are just being an ass.

You're calling people cancer for shitting on their own region?
Who the fuck do you think you are to judge people on voicing their opinions about their own region? (Which are generally true anyway but that isn't the point).
NA fans and psychology isn't what's stopping NA teams getting better, did you handpick this from reddit?
I can readily tell you oce is garbage. Should you call me cancer by being able to recognise and accept that there are things we don't excel at?

Game 2 was unacceptably poor.  My only real complaint.

*NEVER* do you repeat a game entirely that you just lost, even if you think it wasn't because of the picks.

-------

Going into it, I knew Huhi was outclassed heavily, and the Pick/Ban phase (because it didn't alternate) would only further this problem since Faker always had the option to last pick if they focused him in bans.

I also knew Aphromoo (everyone sing his praise *wooo*) was one of the people most likely to get caught and picked off because he's consistently mispositioned on the map.

Darshan wouldn't shine because of the meta not favoring his best style of play.

This left Xmithie and Stixxay, both were performing well, and carried the majority of CLG's hope to actually take a win in the series.  Stixxay made a lot of mistakes unfortunately, and Xmithie was a non-factor in team fights in these games.  So they lost.

I mean, NA kind of sucks compared to Korea.  That is a reality, just like U.S. women's soccer is really good.  it's largely a cultural obstacle (professional gaming is taken much more seriously in Korea) more than a player base issue, and there are plenty of moments in some professional matches that make you believe that both NA and EU are "clown fiestas".  that being said, I am proud of CLG for doing so well, and they should not be ashamed of losing to SKT T1.  nobody should.  it would be like being ashamed for losing a war to the U.S.  sure, it's possible to win, but the odds are so heavily stacked against you that it's not likely at all.  I'm personally more of a fan of the Korean region, even though I don't follow eSports much at all, simply because they are at a higher level than most of the other scenes (they won two out of the three finals they played in from my understanding).  I would love to be able to root for my own country as the best in the world, but right now NA is subpar to Korea and probably will always be

If they would have changed it up on match 2, i think they could have had a better chance by match 3. but they literally wasted an entire match.

Really?  Why root for a team that can't win?  I'm not a NALCS fan, but if I was, I'd expect far more.  Watching competitions where the outcome is unknown is what makes it entertaining.  SKT dominating everyone else terribly boring and no fans should accept losing.  CLG is an established team should have far higher expectations.  The wildcards may need the experience, but the other regions have been at this for a while.  Continually losing and getting blown out should be embarrassing.  It should be celebrate as a moral victory.
